awd_titl_txt: 14th Workshop on Cyanobacteria: Promoting collaborative science and early career scientists in the field of cyanobacterial physiology and applications
awd_abstract_narration:
This award will support early career researcher attendance at the 14th Workshop on Cyanobacteria. The conference will be held at the main campus of Michigan State University in East Lansing, Michigan June 16-19 of 2022. The conference aims to promote collaborative, interdisciplinary research by bringing engineers and life science researchers together at the same venue.  The conference is designed to be highly interactive, with talks, poster sessions and informal meetings. Conference sessions will include topics such as cell biology, synthetic biology, photosynthesis and metabolism, and microbial ecology. There will be ample opportunity for sharing the latest research results and for networking.

The Workshop on Cyanobacteria series is a long-standing conference that brings together an international team of research scientists in the area of cyanobacterial biology and biotechnology. The Workshop presents a unique opportunity to facilitate intense and productive communication between researchers from multiple disciplines, all sharing a common interest in cyanobacteria either as the direct subject of their research or as experimental models to investigate fundamental scientific questions. Keeping with the traditions of the Workshop on Cyanobacteria series, a main focus is placed on the training and inclusion of the next generation of scientists.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.

por.por_cntn:
This Award supported activities at the 14th Workshop on Cyanobacteria, a scientific conference emphasizing early-career researchers. The Workshop on Cyanobacteria provides a forum to enrich training of graduate students and postdoctoral researchers, stimulate intellectual discussions in the area of basic/applied cyanobacterial biology, and to foster enthusiasm of the next generation of cyanobacterial biologists. The scientific focus of the Workshop is upon recent research on cyanobacterial related to its biological, ecological, and biotechnological importance. Briefly, cyanobacteria are bacteria capable of performing photosynthetic metabolism similarly to plants and algae. Cyanobacteria as a group possess an enormous diversity of ecological specializations, metabolic potentials, and morphological characteristics. Cyanobacteria are now being actively considered for potential biotechnology functions - both as a chassis organism that can be engineered for bioproduction using light and carbon dioxide as inputs, and also as a valuable research model to inform efforts to improve photosynthetic productivity in plants. From a global perspective, cyanobacteria are major contributors to the global oxygen, carbon, and nitrogen cycles - a significant amount of foundational scientific knowledge of photosynthetic reaction mechanisms have depended heavily on the use of cyanobacterial models.  

This NSF Award supported three specific goals with regard to the 14th Workshop on Cyanobacteria:

1.  Increase conference accessibility for graduate students, postdocs, and early-career (e.g., early Assistant professor) PIs by defraying costs of participation through waivers for registration and housing costs to attend the conference.
2. Provide financial support for a session during the conference on discussion of how the COVID-19 health crisis impacted career development of graduate students and postdoctoral fellows. The focus of the rountable discussion was on brainstorming strategies for scientific networking and professional development and identifying outside resources that could be leveraged to support career development for early-stage scientists.
3. Incidental support was requested to host an additional roundtable discussion related to the state of current bioinformatic databases and resources for the cyanobacterial community. 

The 14th Workshop on Cyanobacteria was hosted June 16-19, 2022 in East Lansing, Michigan. A total of 166 attendees were involved in the Wokshop, and the event included 28 scientific talks, 63 posters, an early-career rountable discussion, a workshop/roundtable on cyanobacterial informatics tools, 3 different social outings, a banquet-style capstone dinner, and a special session honoring the career contributions of an investigator important to foundational discoveries in cyanobacterial research community. 16 of the total 28 scientific talks scheduled at the Workshop were delivered by graduate students or postdocs, while 3 additional talks were from early-career Assistant Professors.A total of 22 registration waivers were supported through this Award, emphasizing the participation of early-career scientists and increasing participation of underrepresented groups in STEM. Activities at the 14th Workshop on Cyanobacteria also led to the formation of an independent Advisory Board that influenced the development and direction of the online genomics and bioinformatics database, CyanoCyc.
